page.title: 17PROBLEMS OF THE RIVER
page.content: {The Mersey}is heavily polluted, having a large effect on the ecology of the area. The pollution is a result of chemical waste, sewage, rubbish and contamination with silt. The North West Water Authority has estimated that over the next 20 years, in excess of Â£2000 million will be needed to control the pollution. Although it is necessary to continually clean the water, dredging is only required where the Mersey is part of the Ship Canal. The other major problem caused by the River is that of traffic congestion in Warrington itself. In this area, the only ways to cross the Mersey are at Bridge Foot, in the town centre, and at Kingsway Bridge. A scheme is at present underway to improve the crossing at Bridge Foot.
